_header: While the strong I-armed keepeth his hold or his hall
_description: A couplet in long lines in a Latin sermon

OxfBal149.Transcription:
Wyle the stronge yarmed keputh his holde or his halleIn pes And in
                    quiete beth alle
OxfBal149.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.131.
